Submodules

smartdada2.GetMaxEE module

smartdada2.GetMaxEE.read_size_by_maxEE(FastqEntries, left: int, right: int)

Takes reads and calculates the sum of the expected error for each read before any trimming and after obvious trimming.

Parameters:

  • FastqEntries (FastqEntry) – reads taken from fastq files

  • left (int) – trim value output from trim_ends_less_than_threshold

  • right (int) – trunc value output from trim_ends_less_than_threshold

Returns:

dataframe containing two columns

Return type:

pd.dataframe

smartdada2.GetPairedendFiles module

smartdada2.GetPairedendFiles.getPairedFiles(main_fastq: str, output_f: str, output_r: str)

If paired end sequencing was performed get two files containing reverse and forward sequences.

Parameters:

  • main_fastq (str) – one FASTq formatted file containing all

  • reads –

  • output_f (str) – output file path for forward sequences

  • output_r (str) – output file path for reverse sequences

Returns:

two fastq files will be written containing forward and reverse reads separately.

Return type:

files

smartdada2.GetPairedendFiles.main()

smartdada2.GetSubsamples module

smartdada2.GetSubsamples.main()
smartdada2.GetSubsamples.subsample(input_fp: str, subsample: int, output_fp: str)

Takes one FASTQ file and outputs subsets of the reads.

Parameters:

  • input_fp (str) – FASTQ file path

  • subsample (int) – number of reads in subset

  • output_fp (str) – FASTQ file subset output path

Returns:

A fastq formatted file containing a subset of the original reads.

smartdada2.GetTrimParameters module

smartdada2.GetTrimParameters.get_trim_length_avgEE(avgEE_list, left, right)

This function takes a list of average expected error per position and indexing sites to return a list of trim sites, read length, and average EE

Parameters:

  • avgEE_list (list) – average expected error per position

  • left (int) – left index

  • right (int) – right index

Returns:

string of indexes, length of read, average EE per position

Return type:

list

smartdada2.GetTrimParameters.read_size_by_avg_EE(FastqEntries, left: int, right: int, max_trim_perc=0.2)

Creates a dataframe containing average expected error per position for each length of read calculated within certain ranges of positions (e.g., not taking out more than 20% off of either end)

Parameters:

  • FastqEntries (FastqEntry) – reads taken from fastq files

  • left (integer) – left index

  • right (integer) – right index

  • max_trim_perc (float, optional) – max percentage of the read trimmed on

  • 0.2. (either end. Defaults to) –

Returns:

dataframe containing 3 columns: trim positions, read length, and average EE per position

Return type:

pandas dataframe

smartdada2.GetTrimParameters.trim_ends_less_than_threshold(avg_qs_list, threshold=30, max_trim_per=0.1)

Perform obvious trimming: moving from the middle index to the left and then to the right, the first index with a value lower than the threshold will be the potential trim index

Parameters:

  • avg_qs_list – list of floats list of average quality scores per position

  • threshold – integer quality score between 0 and 42

  • max_trim_per – float maximum percentage of trimming performed at either end

Returns:

return tuple of two integers potential left and right trim values
